RV Rentals near Boardwalk RV Resort in Homestead, Florida Dates Open the travel date picker Guests: 1 Search Sign Up Log In Help List Your RV RV Rentals near Boardwalk RV Resort Homestead, Florida Boardwalk RV Resort Image Source: http://boardwalkrv.com/gallery/ This resort sits conveniently in Homestead, which is near the Florida Everglades and the Keys. Since it’s a gated community, you won’t have to worry about safety while you vacation here. There are also plenty of nearby attractions, including Biscayne National Park, Everglades National Park, Homestead-Miami Speedway, and Coral Castle. Why You’ll Love Boardwalk RV Resort While staying at this resort, you can take advantage of the large clubhouse, lending library, billiard room, and BBQ pit. There is also a general store, where you can purchase everything from replacement parts for your RV to food and drinks. Complimentary Wi-Fi is available at the office and in the clubhouse, so you’ll have no trouble checking in on social media to post your fresh set of vacation pictures. What People Are Saying About Boardwalk RV Resort “This is by far one of the best RV resorts in Florida. I have gone to many campgrounds/RV resorts all around Florida. The first day we stayed here, at The Boardwalk, we knew it would be our winter home for many years to come. Staff is very professional and will do everything to make your stay great.” – Jean Dostaler, Google Review Amenities 30/50 AMP Back-In Full Hookups Laundry Pet Friendly Pool Showers Location Get Directions Boardwalk RV Resort 100 NE 6th Ave. Homestead, Florida 33030 (305) 248-2487 Opening Hours Visit Website! About Us Board of Directors Staff Careers Strategic Plan Contact, Policies, Public Records, RFPs History of Leadership & Innovation Engagement and Inclusion at MHP The Massachusetts Housing Partnership (MHP) A public nonprofit affordable housing organization that works in concert
                                            with the Governor and the Executive Office of Housing and Livable
                                            Communities (EOHLC) to increase the supply of affordable housing in
                                            Massachusetts. MHP About Us Staff Staff Steering Committee MHP's Steering Committee helps drive the organization forward, adapt to changes in our environment, and ensure our long-term success. Clark Ziegler Executive Director Email | 857-317-8585 Clark Ziegler is Executive Director of the Massachusetts Housing Partnership, a quasi-public state agency that finances affordable rental housing, provides mortgage financing for first-time home buyers, provides technical assistance for housing and neighborhood development, and is a major contributor to state housing policy. He has been with MHP since its inception in 1985 and has been chief executive since 1990. During his tenure MHP has delivered financing or technical assistance in nearly every city and town in the Commonwealth, including financing for more than 33,500 affordable rental housing units and more than 25,700 affordable homes for low-income first-time buyers. In total MHP has delivered $6.5 billion in below-market financing either directly or through participating banks. Between 1976 and 1981, Clark was in Washington, DC as an LBJ Intern, legislative assistant and then administrative assistant (chief of staff) to Massachusetts Congressman Robert Drinan, where he specialized in energy, environmental, budget and tax policy and staffed the House Subcommittee on Environment, Energy and Natural Resources. From 1983 to 1985 he was Deputy Director of Development and Public Affairs at the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority. Clark serves as a governor's appointee on the board of the Community Economic Development Assistance Corporation, which provides financing and technical assistance to community-based nonprofits across Massachusetts. Additionally, he chairs the board of the Housing Partnership Fund, a federally certified community development financial institution and a lending affiliate of the Housing Partnership Network, an organization that brings together the nation's leading housing and community development nonprofits. He served on Governor Healey’s Unlocking Housing Production Commission and for 11 years was a director and officer of the National Association of Affordable Housing Lenders before stepping down in 2020. He recently completed four years as a founding board member of Housing Navigator Massachusetts, a nonprofit tech startup that developed a searchable web portal for all subsidized housing units in the Commonwealth and is champion of a universal online application for affordable housing. As an Ipswich resident, Clark served as chairman and as a 15-year member of the town’s Finance Committee, overseeing local spending on municipal government and public education and making recommendations on zoning and all other matters before town meeting. In 2006 he received the Community Service Award from Citizens Housing and Planning Association. In 2011 the Boston Globe named him one of the top 10 innovators in Massachusetts. In addition, he was honored with a Nolan Leadership Award from Lawyers Clearinghouse in 2024. Clark earned his bachelor's degree from Hampshire College and his master's degree in public policy from the Kennedy School at Harvard University. Mark Curtiss Managing Director Email | 857-317-8570 Mark Curtiss is managing director of the Massachusetts Housing Partnership, a public non-profit agency that finances affordable rental housing, provides mortgage financing for first-time homebuyers through dozens of Massachusetts banks, offers technical assistance for housing and neighborhood development, and is deeply involved in state housing policy. He joined MHP in 1991 and was named managing director in 2003. In this role, Curtiss is responsible for managing MHP’s $1.5 billion multifamily loan fund, including oversight of program development, loan underwriting, loan origination, portfolio management, and capital sources, which include Massachusetts banks, Fannie Mae, and FHA MAP and risk-sharing products. Curtiss is the architect of MHP’s rental housing loan programs including permanent financing, green and healthy financing, lines of credit, and credit enhancement for tax-exempt bonds, and he is directly responsible for the growth of the loan fund from its inception to over 26,000 units financed with no loan losses in the history of the portfolio. He also serves as a director of the National Association of Affordable Housing Lenders, which represents leading banks and nonprofit loan funds across the U.S. engaged in community development lending. Before starting at MHP, Curtiss worked at Harvard's Joint Center for Housing Studies, where he researched national housing trends for the "State of the Nation's Housing" report and analyzed innovative mortgage products for Nobel laureate Franco Modigliani and Denise DiPasquale. Prior to that, he worked on the staff for Secretary Amy Anthony at the Massachusetts Executive Office of Communities and Development. He received his master's degree in public policy from Harvard’s Kennedy School and his bachelor of science degree from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Charleen Tyson Chief Financial & Administrative Officer Email | 857-317-8510 Charleen Tyson brings a wealth of experience to MHP as a finance executive in both the non-profit and public sectors. Prior to joining MHP, she served for three years as executive vice president and CFO for MassDevelopment. In this role, she managed finance and accounting, human resources, administration and technology for this quasi-public economic development agency with $600 million in total assets . Before MassDevelopment, she had been director of finance at the New England Aquarium, controller at the Massachusetts Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals/Angell Memorial Hospital, and held various positions with the Massachusetts Teachers Association. Tyson serves as treasurer of the Elizabeth Stone House in Jamaica Plain, which provides shelter and transitional housing for battered women. She also serves on the South Shore Charter School Board of Trustees, and on the finance committee for the Town of Hull. She received her MBA from Simmons College School of Management and did her undergraduate work in business management and science at Bridgewater State. Danielle Kinkel General Counsel Email | 857-317-8530 Danielle Kinkel is MHP's general counsel and a member of MHP's executive team. She is responsible for guiding MHP's legal affairs in all internal and external matters as well as participating in strategic planning and goal-setting for MHP, a self-supporting, non-profit quasi-public agency that creates and preserves affordable housing. Prior to MHP, she was a real estate attorney at Nolan Sheehan Patten (NSP) in Boston from 2009 to 2018. She began as associate and was named partner in 2016. At NSP, Danielle was responsible for managing and supervising legal teams through the structuring and closing of complex affordable housing finance transactions. She also advised governmental, quasi-governmental, non-profit and institutional lenders on a variety of housing and real estate development subjects, including zoning and permitting matters, housing subsidy statutes and regulations, tax credit structures and compliance, leasing and condominium regimes, real estate conveyancing issues, corporate entity formation and 501 (c)(3) applications. She is past co-chair of the Housing and Community Development Committee of Commercial Real Estate Women of Boston (CREW Boston) and is an active member of the Affordable Housing Committee of the Boston Bar Association, the Massachusetts Real Estate Bar Association, the Young Professionals Group of Citizens’ Housing and Planning Association (CHAPA), and the American Bar Association’s Forum on Affordable Housing and Community Development. Her community service activities include pro bono representation of 3L Place, Inc., a nonprofit dedicated to providing lifelong educational opportunities and ongoing support for adults with autism. She also provides ongoing pro bono representation of clients through Lawyers Clearinghouse and has provided pro bono legal representation to victims of Hurricane Katrina on matters such as clearing title to “heirs’ property” and filing grant applications for funding to rehabilitate and reconstruct damaged homes She has a bachelor of arts degree in history and philosophy from the University of Michigan, a master's degree in education policy from Boston College and a law degree from Northeastern University. Dana LeWinter Chief of Public and Community Engagement Email | 857-317-8536 Dana LeWinter joined MHP in 2023. She directs MHP’s community assistance, data and policy, and public affairs teams. She leads MHP’s efforts to expand the supply and affordability of housing in the Commonwealth through research and analysis, legislation and public policy, education and training for local officials and community leaders, and technical assistance supporting local housing development. Most recently she was director of the Municipal Engagement Initiative for Citizens’ Housing and Planning Association (CHAPA). Earlier in her career she was executive director of the Massachusetts Community and Banking Council (now the Partnership for Financial Equity), which brings together banks and community leaders to increase the availability of credit and financial services in low- and moderate-income communities and communities of color in the Commonwealth. She earned her master’s degree in urban and environmental policy and planning at Tufts University and her bachelor’s degree in sociology from Brandeis University. Legal & Compliance This team helps oversee the legal and compliance aspects of MHP's work. Suzanne Cartledge Deputy General Counsel Email | 857-317-8560 Suzanne Cartledge joined MHP in 2024. Reporting to the General Counsel, she provides legal advice to MHP’s internal teams, the management team and staff. She is the lead counsel on real estate matters and closings, both those closed in-house and by outside counsel. She assists in other matters related to MHP’s affordable housing finance programs, and in employment, contracting, interagency, legislative, and other issues. Suzanne has spent more than 25 years structuring and closing commercial real estate financings, most recently serving as Managing Director and Associate Chief Counsel in the Investment Division at John Hancock Financial Services in Boston. Previously, she was a real estate associate at two esteemed Boston law firms. Suzanne is a member of CREW Boston and a fellow of the American College of Mortgage Attorneys. Suzanne earned her Juris Doctor from Vilanova University School of Law and her Bachelor of Arts at Hofstra University. Suzanne Cartledge | LinkedIn Jameel Moore Senior Counsel, Procurement and Contracts Email | (857) 317-8518 Jameel Moore joined MHP in 2024. Reporting to the General Counsel, she provides legal advice to MHP’s internal teams, senior management, and the executive team. She is the lead counsel on procurement and contract matters. She also assists in other matters related to MHP’s affordable housing finance programs, operations and management, and regulatory compliance. Prior to joining MHP, she worked at a mid-size Boston law firm. Jameel brings several years of experience as a transactional attorney focusing on complex contracts, government regulations and commercial real estate for both private and public sector clients. She has experience advising clients across various industries on statutory and regulatory compliance, including state and federal procurement laws. Jameel currently serves as President of the Massachusetts Black Lawyers Association , an organization dedicated to fostering diversity equity, and inclusion within the legal field while advocating for systemic change to promote justice and equality in our communities. She earned her J.D. and LL.M. in Banking and Financial Law from Boston University School of Law and her B.A. from Boston College. Vanessa Okonkwo Counsel Email | 857-317-8534 Vanessa Okonkwo joined MHP as a paralegal and loan closing coordinator and was promoted to counsel in 2018. She is responsible for assisting MHP's general counsel in in the guidance of all MHP legal affairs. Prior to MHP, she worked as a credit officer at Diamond Bank and as an attorney the law firm of Paul Usoro & Company. She has law degrees from Abia State University and Nigerian Law School and a masters of laws from Suffolk University. She is involved in several organizations, including the American Bar Association's Forum on Affordable Housing and Community Development Law, Boston Bar Association, CREW Boston, Institute of Chartered Secretaries & Administrators, U.K (ICSA). She also volunteers at her local church. First and foremost, she has a passion for affordable housing. "As someone originally from a third world country, eradication of poverty and homelessness is a cause dear to my heart," she says. "This is why I am very committed to helping MHP achieve its goal of increasing affordable housing in Massachusetts." Dolly Abberton Loan Closing Specialist Email | 857-317-8535 Dolly Abberton rejoined MHP in 2020. She has over 20 years over paralegal experience. She worked at MHP from 2005 to 2014 and had ensuing stints at Hinckley Allen & Snyder LLP (2014-17) and MassHousing (2017-2020). She has a bachelor's degree in business administration from Northeastern and master's degree in education from University of Massachusetts Boston. Sarah Mostafa Senior Risk and Compliance Manager Email | 857-317-8580 Sarah Mostafa joined MHP in 2023. She oversees risk and compliance responsibilities across MHP, including: Assisting teams in the development and preparation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and conducting risk and needs assessments to determine the most effective strategies for ensuring teams and individuals comply with both internal policies (such as the HR handbook and new contracts process) and external regulations (including regulatory obligations and mandatory reporting requirements). In addition, she leads the design and implementation of a comprehensive compliance and ethics program. She also conducts programmatic and system risk assessments for the ONE and ONE+ Mortgage programs. She analyzes data to identify emerging risks, trends, and opportunities for process improvement. She reports on risk findings, proposes mitigation strategies, and outlines audit procedures for management. Furthermore, she leads and coordinates cross-functional teams to drive various system enhancement initiatives. Previously, Sarah held roles as a Senior Auditor at the Massachusetts Department of Public Health, a Business Management Specialist at the Massachusetts Division of Capital Management and Maintenance (DCAMM), and a Compliance Analyst at State Street Corporation. She holds an MBA from the Isenberg School of Management at UMass Amherst and a Bachelor of Science in Business Management from New England College of Business and Finance. Sarah is also a certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt and a certified Corporate Compliance and Ethics Professional (CCEP). Judsine Blaisdell Legal Assistant Email | 857-317-8511 Judsine (she/her) first joined MHP in 2024 on a yearlong contract before joining the Legal & Compliance team on a full-time basis in 2025. She brings capacity to the team with her experience managing legal documents, coordinating administrative functions, and enhancing operational efficiency. Prior to joining MHP, Judsine worked as an Administrative Assistant at Nolan Sheehan Patten LLP and as an Office Assistant at New England Law Boston. She earned her Bachelor of Arts with Individualized Concentration: Non-Profit Arts Management and Social Justice from the University of Massachusetts Amherst. Judsine was particularly drawn to MHP’s commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging, and is eager to contribute to a team that values these principles. Judsine Blaisdell | LinkedIn Policy & Communications Policy and Communications collaborates internally with each team to highlight MHP's efforts to move affordable housing forward. Calandra Clark Director of Policy and Communications Email | 857-317-8524 Calandra (Callie) Clark joined MHP’s public affairs staff in 2008 and worked in policy analysis, research, messaging and communication strategy. In early 2017 she became Co-Director of MHP’s newly created Center for Housing Data, in 2019 became the Director of Policy, and in 2023 became the Director of Policy and Communications. Clark has extensive experience in policy analysis and web strategy and in crafting presentations for legislators, local public officials and other public audiences. She has a bachelor’s degree in international development from Clark University and a master’s degree in urban and regional policy from Northeastern University. Lisa Braxton Communications Manager Email | 857-301-1526 Lisa Braxton plays an integral role in supporting MHP’s communications output and strategies by providing tactical support and maintaining continuous relevant content through multiple communication streams such as social media, web, and print. She works closely with teams for specific department content and writes, edits, and creates content and posts to the platforms best suited for the content. She also produces mission-conscious” content that is supported by photos, videos and graphics. A graduate of Hampton University, with a master's degree from Northwestern University’s Medill School of Journalism, and a Master of Fine Arts in creative writing from Southern New Hampshire University, she is an Emmy-nominated former television journalist with experience in print and radio as well. Most recently she was a public affairs manager and public educator for the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA). She was drawn to MHP due to her lifelong interest in affordable housing, which is expressed in her novel, The Talking Drum , which focuses on the impact of urban gentrification. "Much of the story was inspired by what I witnessed in the city where I grew up, Bridgeport, Connecticut," she said. Her novel has won or been nominated for several awards, including an Outstanding Literary Award from the National Association of Black Journalists and a gold medal from the Independent Publisher Book Awards. She is also the author of the memoir, Dancing Between the Raindrops: A Daughter's Reflections on Love and Loss, published in 2024. About Us — Boardwalk Investment Group, Inc. Home About Us Management Leasing Sales Consulting Contact Us Boardwalk Investment Group, Inc. Home About Us Management Leasing Sales Consulting Contact Us About Us Get to know us better. Boardwalk Investment Group, Inc. AMO® has been in the real estate services business for over 23 years. We have managed over $750 million in real estate assets in 11 California counties. Our office in Walnut Creek services all of California. Boardwalk is proud to be one of the first and few Bay Area property management firms to hold the Accredited Management Organization (AMO®) designation awarded by the Institute of Real Estate Management (IREM®). Darren G. Merritt and Stanley T. Smallwood are the principals of Boardwalk Investment Group and leaders of the Boardwalk team. Both principals are directly available to clients and are involved in every account served by Boardwalk. Darren G. Merritt Darren G. Merritt is President and CEO of Boardwalk and a graduate of Louisiana State University with a B.S. in Engineering. He has over 22 years practical experience in the real estate industry in management, leasing, sales and consulting. Highly credentialed in the real estate industry, Darren is a Certified Project Manager (CPM®), Real Property Administrator (RPA®) and a Certified Commercial Investment Manager (CCIM). He is also a licensed California Real Estate broker. Darren has been elected to numerous leadership positions in associations such as the Institute of Real Estate Management (IREM), Building Owners' and Managers' Association (BOMA®) and CCIM. His extensive involvement in organizations such as these provides a variety of benefits to Boardwalk clients, including advocacy for clients’ real estate interests, knowledge of pending legislation, and an invaluable network of business contacts. Currently, Darren is an active member of the Institute of Real Estate Management (IREM), the BOMA® Oakland/East Bay, BOMA® California Board of Directors and Northern California CCIM. Darren has previously served as: 2013 President - Elect for the Institute of Real Estate Management (IREM®) 2012 Treasurer for the Institute of Real Estate Management (IREM®) 1998 & 1999 President Building Owners & Managers Association (BOMA®) California Board of Directors 1994, 1995 & 2000 President Oakland/East Bay Building Owners & Managers Association (BOMA®) Board of Directors. Oakland/East Bay Building Owners & Managers Association (BOMA®) Vice President and Treasurer Governor to Building Owners & Managers Association (BOMA®) International Board of Governors President, Treasurer and Director for the Northern California Certified Commercial Investment Member (CCIM) Chapter Darren has been an instructor for the Building Owners’ and Managers’ Institute (BOMI®) classes and is a facilitator for the IREM #800 Ethics Course. Stanley T. Smallwood Stanley T. Smallwood is Vice President and CFO of Boardwalk and a graduate of Louisiana State University with a B.S. in Engineering. Stan joined the Boardwalk team a year after its founding in 1987. With his command of real estate industry accounting principals, Stan has successfully operated the accounting side of Boardwalk’s real estate services business for more than 23 years. Clients have recognized Boardwalk’s accounting under Stan as some of the most accurate, precise and thorough in the industry. Stan has used Yardi property management software for more than 23 years. (Globally, Yardi is the leading provider of cost effective, high performance investment management, asset management and property management software-solutions.) Stan’s Yardi expertise and flexibility allow him to customize reports for clients. Stan avidly follows changes in both law and practice in the industry in order to continue to provide superior service to Boardwalk customers. Stan is also a licensed California Real Estate Broker. Marlowe M. Prinzing Marlowe M. Prinzing is the founder of Boardwalk Investment Group, Inc. She has over 35 years of property management experience working with developers and owners in retail, commercial and residential real estate. She is a California Real Estate Broker, a CPM®, an Accredited Residential Manager (ARM®). Some of Marlowe’s contributions to and achievements in the industry include: Awarded 1997 Contra Costa Woman of the Year in Business and Technology 1996 President for IREM® San Francisco Bay Area Chapter #21. Her work with the Chapter helped it earn the National Gold Award. Founded the Real Estate Alliance for Charity where she continues to serve as an advisor to the Executive Board. Served as 1988 President of the Diablo Valley Property Managers Association where she was instrumental in establishing classes in the East Bay for individuals seeking their CPM® and RPA® designations. Serves as a National Faculty Member for IREM®, teaching the Accredited Resident Manager Course #101 and acting as a facilitator for the #800 Ethics Course. Melissa Kolias Chief Design Officer Phone Number: 403-804-2213 Email: melissa@bwalk.com Melissa is an industry visionary, tapping her expertise in designing with a purpose to create a holistic approach for the rebranding and repositioning of Boardwalk’s communities. Bhavnesh Jaraim Chief Information Officer Phone Number: 403-206-6865 Email: bhavnesh@bwalk.com Since joining Boardwalk in 2017, following a successful year as a consultant, Bhavnesh has been an instrumental figure in transforming the vision and operations of the IT department, eventually stepping into the role of Chief Information Officer and Vice President of Technology. Armed with a Master's degree in Electrical and Information Engineering (with Distinction) and over 20 years of industry experience, Bhavnesh combines business acumen with deep technical expertise. In addition to leading technology innovation and operational efficiency initiatives, Bhavnesh is responsible for overseeing the company's cybersecurity strategy and functions, ensuring the protection of digital assets and the integrity of critical systems. His involvement in high-value projects across various industries illustrates his proficiency in technology program design, process strategy development, and risk management. Bhavnesh is a passionate change agent, focused on innovation, team leadership, community building, and strategic engagement, driving both security and technological advancement within the organization. Nandini Somayaji General Counsel and Corporate Secretary Phone Number : 403-671-7152 Email : nsomayaji@bwalk.com Nandini joined the Trust as General Counsel and Corporate Secretary in 2023. Nandini brings over 15 years of legal experience having previously worked with DIRTT Environmental Solutions as Senior Vice President Talent, General Counsel & Corporate Secretary, as well as Deloitte Legal and Bennett Jones. Samantha Kolias-Gunn Senior Vice President, Corporate Development and Governance Phone Number: 403-206-6790 Email: samantha@bwalk.com Samantha joined Boardwalk as a member of the company’s founding family and Board of Trustees in 2013. Samantha Adams Senior Vice President, Investments Phone Number : 368-996-5613 Email : sadams@bwalk.com Samantha joined the Trust as Senior Vice President, Investments in 2024. Samantha previously served as a Senior Vice President of Pure Multi-Family REIT LP (“Pure”), from the time of its IPO until its sale to Cortland Partners in 2019 for C$1.6 billion. Prior to her time with Pure, she was one of four principals at the Vancouver-based Sunstone Group of companies and was actively involved in three of Canada’s most successful real estate platforms. Boyd Belisle Vice President, Community & Culture Phone Number: 403-206-6768 Email: boyd@bwalk.com Boyd joined Boardwalk in January of 2012 after 20 years in public and private education, serving as teacher, vice principal and principal. (Specialization: Educational Leadership) from universities in Manitoba and Alberta and is fully bilingual in French. Boyd’s leadership style is defined by openness and humility. He will continue to support and work closely with our entire team, both in the west and east of Canada. Eric Bowers Vice President, Finance and Investor Relations Phone Number: 403-206-6821 Email: ebowers@bwalk.com Eric joined Boardwalk in 2014, supporting the company’s growth initiatives as a member of the Investment team, first as an Analyst and subsequently in the roles of Director of Acquisitions and Vice President of Corporate Analysis. In his current role as Vice President of Finance and Investor Relations, Eric is a key contributor to Boardwalk’s finance, investor relations, financial planning and analysis, and strategic initiatives. Arv Dhol Vice President, Special Projects Engineering & Design Phone Number: 403-206-6778 Email: adhol@bwalk.com Arv joined the Boardwalk Family in 2007, after working as a civilian engineer with the Department of National Defence, and later as a private construction management consultant. Since joining Boardwalk, he has served in various Director roles before joining the Boardwalk Design Team upon its inception, in late 2016. Prior to assuming his current role, he was acting as the Senior Director of Special Projects. Arv is dedicated to helping ensure the holistic fruition of Boardwalk’s Design Team vision, through construction management fundamentals centred on delivering affordable, quality communities that our Resident Members are proud to call home.  Dedicated to Boardwalk’s culture of “Love Always,” he thrives on team success achieved through passion, grit and trust. Arv is a professional engineer and a graduate of the University of Calgary, holding a Bachelors and Masters of Science degree in Civil Engineering. Helen Mix Vice President, People Phone Number: 403-206-6778 Email: helen@bwalk.com Helen is Boardwalk’s talent ringleader, providing key leadership to the hiring, training and retention of Boardwalk’s talented Associates. Haroon Khan Vice President, Operations Phone Number: 403-206-6893 Email: hkhan@bwalk.com Haroon Khan is a dynamic leader at Boardwalk, whose journey with our company began in Alberta in 2008. Originally from Toronto and a proud alumnus of the University of Toronto, Haroon joined Boardwalk as a Resident Manager at the newly acquired Varsity Square Apartments in September 2008. His dedication and proven expertise saw him excel across various communities, including Varsity Place Apartments and Patrician Village, leading to his appointment as Regional Administrator in Spring 2009. In 2011, Haroon applied for and assumed the role of Community Coordinator, and his career continued to flourish as he was promoted successively to AC, Principal, CD, RD, and finally to VP of Operations in December 2022. Today, as VP Southern Alberta, BC, Ontario & Quebec, Haroon leverages his extensive experience and visionary leadership to drive operational excellence across Boardwalk. Razvan Costin Vice President, Operations Phone Number: 587-756-5925 Email: rcostin@bwalk.com Razvan has been a valued member of the Boardwalk Family since 2008, when he first joined as a Security Associate. Over the years, he has held various leadership roles in operations, building a distinguished career focused on enhancing service quality and fostering strong communities, all while upholding Boardwalk’s guiding principle of Love Always. Ms. Abramsohn has previously held several senior capital market roles including leading real estate capital markets at EY Canada, acting as Senior Vice President for Real Estate at DBRS, leading Canadian real estate equity research at Raymond James Ltd. and as an investment manager of a $2 billion top performing Canadian equity dividend fund at Great West Life. Ms. Abramsohn's extensive capital markets experience spans many complex, high-profile and market leading transactions and entities including initial public offerings, portfolio transactions, privatizations, strategic reviews, complex valuations, mergers and acquisitions as well as a variety of debt and equity financings and investments. Ms. Abramsohn began her career in public accounting with one of the Big 5 accounting firms, ultimately specializing in business valuations. Ms. Abramsohn holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree (with Distinction) from the University of Toronto and holds the CA, CPA, CBV, CFA and CPA (Illinois) professional designations. She is a member of the Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada and Ontario, Canadian Institute of Chartered Business Valuators, CFA Institute and the Toronto CFA Society, and is also registered as a CPA in the state of Illinois. Andrea Goertz Independent Trustee Trustee Since: May 21, 2019 Expertise: Communications, Media Marketing, Property Development, Real Estate, Community Development, Sustainability, Corporate Social Responsibility, Government Relations, Privacy Compliance Formerly Chief Communications & Sustainability Officer at Telus (2011 to 2018) leading a national team responsible for the transformation and execution of a diverse portfolio comprised of real estate, external communications, media relations, privacy, provincial government relations, sustainability, corporate marketing, corporate sponsorships, and corporate social responsibility. Prior thereto, Ms. Goertz held several positions at Telus from 1989 to 2011, including Vice President, Enterprise Services & Strategic Initiatives from 2005 to 2011. Ms. Goertz was Chair of the WXN Women’s Executive Network in Calgary from November 2014 to September 2016 and was the first Canadian on the Board of the Family Online Safety Institute from September 2014 to January 2016. Ms. Goertz also served on the Boards of Theatre Calgary from September 2013 to January 2016, the Telus Calgary Community Board from September 2009 to June 2016, the EPCOR Centre for Performing Arts in Calgary from September 2006 to September 2008, and Alberta Ballet from October 2006 to October 2008. Ms. Goertz served as an Advisory Board member of the University of Calgary’s Haskayne School of Business from September 2009 to June 2016, and a member of Calgary Economic Development’s Business Advisory Committee from 2007 to 2008. Ms. Goertz obtained a Bachelor of Commerce degree with Distinction (Finance) in 1989 and a Master of Business Administration degree in 1995, both from the University of Alberta. Ms. Goertz was a winner of the prestigious WXN Women’s Executive Network Canada’s Most Powerful Women awards in 2012 and 2014. In 2018, Ms. Goertz co-founded “Women on Boards”, an effort supporting increased gender diversity on Boards, and is currently completing the ICD’s Director’s Education Program. About Us - The Boardwalk Skip to content BOOKINGS The Boardwalk / About Us About Us Every time, you choose to host an event at The Boardwalk, you are helping community arts charity Impact Arts deliver even more life-changing creative projects. About The Boardwalk The Boardwalk is a creative, vibrant, and accessible event venue in the heart of Glasgow’s Merchant City. We have a variety of meeting rooms and spaces available for hire including 7 studios and a 180-capacity black box theatre . We play host to a variety of different events from creative workshops, theatre performances, and dance rehearsals, to networking events, company team days, and conferences. Our friendly and experienced team provide excellent customer service as well as tech and equipment support to make sure you have a fantastic event. We can also provide a range of delicious catering options, light refreshments, and drinks. Our social impact The Boardwalk is proud to be a social enterprise. The venue is run by Scottish community arts charity Impact Arts . And all the proceeds made through bookings at The Boardwalk go towards the charity. Impact Arts transforms lives through art and creativity. The charity offers a range of creative programmes for people of all ages facing disadvantages or barriers in Central Scotland. By engaging communities in art projects, Impact Arts empowers individuals to discover their creativity, develop new skills, gain accreditations, build their confidence, and plan their next steps. Through these programmes, the charity fosters positive change, using art as a catalyst for personal growth, improved wellbeing, and social impact. Some of the people who benefit from Impact Arts’ projects include: Children who are struggling to process challenging life events or experiencing anxiety, challenges making friends, or dealing with complex emotions. Impact Arts delivers children’s art therapy and creative play programmes to help them increase their resilience, develop coping strategies, bond with friends and family, and build their confidence and self-esteem. Find out more Young people who have no or few qualifications and may be disengaged from education or unemployed, or at risk of engaging in antisocial behaviour. Impact Arts delivers a range of projects that support young people to develop their core skills, achieve accreditations, undertake work experience, and ultimately move onto a positive destination like further education, work, or training. Find out more Adults who have been homeless or are at risk of becoming homeless. Impact Arts delivers a range of creative interior design projects that help people transform their tenancy into their home. Teaching skills in upcycling, sewing, painting, and decorating and budgeting, this programme ensures that people are supported to create a welcoming home that they love and feel proud of. Find out more Older people who are feeling isolated or suffering from poor mental or physical health. Impact Arts delivers Craft Café in care homes and community settings. This art programme for ages 60+ brings together artists with older people to develop new skills, reconnect with people and communities, and bring joy and meaning to people’s lives. Find out more Boardwalk (noun) – bord-wok A boardwalk provides a safe pathway over difficult terrain The Team Fiona Doring is CEO of Impact Arts, Chair of Scottish Contemporary Art Network, and a Board Member of Edinburgh College. Fiona’s vision is for The Boardwalk to be an inclusive and vibrant cultural venue and social enterprise, that brings people together from different backgrounds and from across sectors to support creative engagement in the heart of Glasgow’s Merchant City. Laura Wright brings many years of event management experience to The Boardwalk and is the first point of contact for anyone looking to book our venue. Laura takes pride in helping The Boardwalk continue to grow into one of Glasgow’s best creative social enterprises, provides space to meet, rehearse, and perform. For booking enquiries, email: [email protected] Mairi McLaren is Head of Finance & Corporate Services for Impact Arts and is degree-qualified from Strathclyde University Business School. Mairi leads our relationships with our professional suppliers and has been instrumental in the development of social enterprise activity for Impact Arts. Mairi uses her financial expertise to ensure The Boardwalk maximises resources and acts as a catalyst for positive change. Blair Sutherland manages the operational procedures for all of The Boardwalk and Impact Arts’ facilities, including all aspects of our buildings and equipment, maintenance, and health and safety. Blair enjoys that no two days are the same at Impact Arts. He finds it a joy, and often very humbling, being part of a company that changes people’s lives for the better. Gillian Rome leads all the Marketing & Communications for Impact Arts and The Boardwalk. Gillian loves sharing stories about the many varied events taking place in The Boardwalk and can support you by promoting your events via our social media channels and website. Gillian is currently on maternity leave. In the interim, please email Sophie Campbell with any marketing or press enquiries: [email protected] The wider team We have a wonderful, friendly team at The Boardwalk who are here to ensure your event runs smoothly. They are on hand to welcome guests, serve refreshments, and ensure your sound and lighting requirements run exactly as you want them to.
